intro: Tylophora chlorantha, commonly known as the green tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruits are follicles containing numerous seeds. Tylophora chlorantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
